title: one delegate can add another delegate and delete other delegates, exposing all confidential inbox messages

profile.name: Zivver
profile.about: Solution for secure email & file-transfer and to prevent data leaks

vulnerability_information:
## Summary:
One Delegate can add another delete and delete other delegates, exposing all inbox messages to other delegates and hence exposing all the confidential info can be seen by newly added delegates

## Steps To Reproduce:
[add details for how we can reproduce the issue]

  1. Login as User1 and add a delegate User2.
  2. Logout from User1 account, and login as User1, shift profile to User2.
  3. Get the limited access token from the below request after you shift profile to User2 from User1

**Request:**
```
POST /api/authentication/login HTTP/1.1
Host: app.zivver.com
Connection: close
Content-Length: 496
Accept: application/json
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/85.0.4183.102 Safari/537.36
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=UTF-8
Origin: https://app.zivver.com

```

**Response:**
```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json
Content-Length: 1187
Connection: close
Date: Sun, 20 Sep 2020 10:55:32 GMT
Cache-Control: must-revalidate,no-cache,no-store
Access-Control-Allow-Origin: https://app.zivver.com
Vary: Origin
Access-Control-Allow-Credentials: true
Access-Control-Expose-Headers: Date
RateLimit-Limit: 5000, 5000;w=60;id="ial"
RateLimit-Remaining: 4999
RateLimit-Reset: 0
Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=2592000; includeSubDomains; preload
X-Cache: Miss from cloudfront
Via: 1.1 d1f9689a3caeb0a19dffbc049d2b2141.cloudfront.net (CloudFront)
X-Amz-Cf-Pop: LHR61-C2
X-Amz-Cf-Id: PyjgcA4yJV5VqNC8P0gqtH3bXaZexXV8iugflCsfkXA6D9KLxT_Nvw==

{
  "access_token": "eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJqc29........,
  "accountId": "6bdf4de6-7d80-4e03-9......",
  "expires_in": 1199,
  "mfa_required": false,
```

4. Now use this limited scope token to check delegates in the primary(admin) account (which should not be allowed) , this is exposing email id of other users which in itself is information disclosure.

Sedn the GET request to :  /api/delegations/delegates

**Before adding another Delegate**
 {F995159}

5. As you can see we have only 1 delegate in the admin(main) account, which you can think of User2 here.

6. Now add another delegate using same limited scope access id that we got, by sending the POST request to : /api/delegations/delegates and providing any Zivver user email id.

**Adding a delegate**
{F5995174}

You can check by logging as User1 also that new delegate is added 
{F995162}

7. Now check again if the new delegate account is added by limited scope access id which User2 has got by shifting profiles:
**User2 checking After adding a new delegate**
{F995160}

8. From the above step, take the older delegate User ID(or any id which you want to delete), I am deleting User2 itself here by using limited scope accessid.: DELETE /api/delegations/delegates/<delegateid>

{F995163}

9. Login as User1, and go to delegate section, you will see a previous delegate is deleted and a new one is added.
{F995161}


This way User1 used profile shift function and able to add new delegates, and delete any delegate from the main account.

## Impact

A delegate user of an account can add other delegates and delete other delegates without admin account password. This can expose all the inbox to the newly added delegate and all security mechanism of encrypted messages will be lost.

activities.message: Please correct the typo in title of report: one delegate can add another delegate and delete other delegates, exposing all confidential inbox messages

additional_data.old_title: One Delegate can add another delete and delete other delegates, exposing all inbox messages to other delegates(full account exposure)
additional_data.new_title: one delegate can add another delegate and delete other delegates, exposing all confidential inbox messages

activities.message:
Hi @mavericknerd, 

thank you for this and your other reports. For this report, I've updated the title as you requested.

For all your reports we will investigate them and reply as soon as possible.

I think it is critical in severity, any other added delegate can read full inbox, since zivver main motive is to to provide secure communication, this is not secure any more, whole communication is visible to others.

Here is as per CVSS: 
{F995865}

Let me know if you think otherwise. 

No interaction of main admin user required for exploiting this.

The severity was changed to Medium because although a delegate account can add other delegate accounts or remove them, an attacker would first have to become a delegate of a victim. Even so, when a new account is added as delegate a notification email is sent to the main account (see attached F996252).

I don't agree at all here, Delegate is a feature of your product, victim itself will use that feature. And what does a mail notification do, when all the data is already exposed to other newly added delegates.

Even if you make in CVSS marking it  as require low privilege, it still make this issue and others high on CVSS scale. 

Can't believe it as medium. :( , let me know if you triaging other bugs that I raised, and let me know if I can dig more and find other bugs.
Infact if the victim(main account) deletes the delegate account after checking the notification mail, the delegated account can add itself again since he will still have limited scope access token
I mean add other account again or many others, confusing victim(main) account whom to remove and whom to keep.

Hi,

> Delegate is a feature of your product, victim itself will use that feature. And what does a mail notification do, when all the data is already exposed to other newly added delegates.

The conditions for this (and your other delegation related bugs) vulnerability to exist, all starts with that a victim first has to add delegation to someone, which is not something that can be done unless the user actually performs this interaction himself (or the attacker has access to the victim's session on the device). That makes the attack already quite complicated to get to this situation.

>Even if you make in CVSS marking it as require low privilege, it still make this issue and others high on CVSS scale
> 
> Can't believe it as medium. :( , let me know if you triaging other bugs that I raised, and let me know if I can dig more and find other bugs.

I've re-evaluated the CVSS, once again, but still end up with a medium. See F997769.

As for your other reports, the delegate sessions has one scope too many that allows access to the resources affected in this report as well as the resources in the other reports. Fixing this report, will then also fix those reports. Not sure yet how to best triage those reports, but they will be triaged, for sure.

--- 

> if the victim(main account) deletes the delegate account after checking the notification mail, the delegated account can add itself again since he will still have limited scope access token

This is not possible, since the delegate session will be invalidated as soon as the delegation is withdrawn.

As per CVSS,
Confidentiality
This metric measures the impact to the confidentiality of the information resources managed by a software component due to a successfully exploited vulnerability. Confidentiality refers to limiting information access and disclosure to only authorized users, as well as preventing access by, or disclosure to, unauthorized ones.

None: There is no loss of confidentiality within the impacted component.
Low: There is some loss of confidentiality. Access to some restricted information is obtained, but the attacker does not have control over what information is obtained, or the amount or kind of loss is constrained. The information disclosure does not cause a direct, serious loss to the impacted component.
High: There is total loss of confidentiality, resulting in all resources within the impacted component being divulged to the attacker. Alternatively, access to only some restricted information is obtained, but the disclosed information presents a direct, serious impact.


Here it is marked as high, any newly added delegate can do whatever a main account can do. Reading inbox message itself is a serious impact and that in itself is a highly confidential information. Who will trust a service if its inbox message can be read by anyone.

Also, I know that issues till now are delegate related but all are on different API endpoint and need access control, hope to see them triage and marked accordingly.

> The conditions for this (and your other delegation related bugs) vulnerability to exist, all starts with that a victim first has to add delegation to someone, which is not something that can be done unless the user actually performs this interaction himself (or the attacker has access to the victim's session on the device). That makes the attack already quite complicated to get to this situation.

I would say, it is not complicated, it is how a victim is using a website feature with a 1 click interaction on adding a delegate.

> I've re-evaluated the CVSS, once again, but still end up with a medium. See Screenshot_2020-09-22_at_15.05.52.png (F997769).

Please check my last comment for this,  and company says on the home page this:
{F997816}

If even leaking a single email to a single delegate is still not confidential enough, I have nothing to add/say. Mind it here all emails can be leaked to thousands of people. 


> As for your other reports, the delegate sessions has one scope too many that allows access to the resources affected in this report as well as the resources in the other reports. Fixing this report, will then also fix those reports. Not sure yet how to best triage those reports, but they will be triaged, for sure.

If for a VDP, I have to point so many things just to make high/critical report as high/critical, too much to ask for. As a researcher, we give our time to find bugs, show impact, and providing proofs for the same.
 
Not happy with what I am seeing here, never faced this on other programs.

I've once more re-evaluated the severity after your feedback and changed the confidentiality parameter to high. 

If you're not happy with what you're seeing here, feel free to not participate in the program.
Hi, do you want me to report other delegate related issues on other endpoints ? or I can ignore those.
Is this fixed? can we disclose it.

Hi @mavericknerd, yes the item was resolved already some time ago. Let met at least update the status of this ticket.

I'll also check with my colleagues if disclosing the issue is already possible. I'll get back to you on that part.
Hi @mavericknerd, we are okay with disclosing this report. Thanks for your contribution!
